description: An island located in the Calm Belt that serves as the home of the Kuja tribe and the Amazon Lily Kingdom, ruled by Boa Hancock. The island becomes a temporary refuge for Luffy after the Marineford War.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Contemplates Rayleigh's Training Proposal
keyEvents.description: At Amazon Lily, Luffy wrestles with the decision between honoring his promise to reunite with his crew and accepting Rayleigh's training offer.
keyEvents.significance: Amazon Lily serves as the setting for one of Luffy's most important decisions in the series.

keyEvents.title: Hancock Supports Luffy
keyEvents.description: Hancock provides emotional support to Luffy during his difficult decision-making process.
keyEvents.significance: Reinforces Amazon Lily's role as a safe haven for Luffy during the post-war period.

description: An artificial sky island that floats on top of a large bubble, constantly drifting with wind currents. The island is inhabited by weather scientists who make their living by temporarily landing on islands and offering to alter their weather. Home to weather manipulation technology including Wind Knots and Weather Balls.

keyEvents.title: Nami's Emotional Breakdown
keyEvents.description: Nami breaks down in tears on Weatheria, expressing her anguish over Ace's death and her desperate need to reunite with Luffy.
keyEvents.significance: A pivotal emotional moment that shows the impact of Ace's death on all the Straw Hats and Nami's deep loyalty to her captain.

keyEvents.title: Nami's Escape Attempt
keyEvents.description: Nami attempts to flee Weatheria by taking Haredas hostage, pursued by residents who suspect her manipulation.
keyEvents.significance: Marks a turning point in Nami's time on Weatheria, eventually leading to her decision to stay and train.

description: A winter island in the Grand Line, also known as Baldimore, the birthplace of the genius scientist Dr. Vegapunk. The island is home to Vegapunk's former laboratory and various mechanical creatures. After Bartholomew Kuma sent Franky here, he spent two years studying Vegapunk's technology.

keyEvents.title: Franky Seeks Help from Kitton
keyEvents.description: Franky requests to use Kitton's ship to leave the winter island, learning about the icebreaker at Vegapunk's laboratory.
keyEvents.significance: Inadvertently leads Franky to discover Vegapunk's laboratory.

keyEvents.title: The Nightmare of Baldimore
keyEvents.description: Franky accidentally triggers a massive explosion that destroys much of Vegapunk's laboratory, an incident that becomes known worldwide as the Nightmare of Baldimore.
keyEvents.significance: A globally significant event that destroys valuable scientific research but gives Franky access to Vegapunk's blueprints.

statusHistory.reason: Vegapunk's laboratory was destroyed in the Nightmare of Baldimore explosion

description: Dr. Vegapunk's abandoned research facility on Karakuri Island, containing advanced technological blueprints and weapons designs. The laboratory was protected by Marine guards and featured a self-destruct mechanism. After its destruction, Franky discovered a hidden secondary laboratory with additional blueprints.

keyEvents.title: Franky Discovers Vegapunk's Laboratory
keyEvents.description: Franky locates the abandoned laboratory and is pursued by Marine guards protecting the facility.
keyEvents.significance: Critical discovery that provides Franky access to advanced technology for his future upgrades.

keyEvents.title: Destruction of the Laboratory
keyEvents.description: Franky accidentally activates the self-destruct mechanism, causing a massive explosion that destroys much of the laboratory and its research materials.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the destruction of priceless scientific research and the creation of a globally known incident.

statusHistory.reason: Discovered by Franky and immediately destroyed
